soc.util

Class DebugRecorder

  • java.lang.Object
    • soc.util.DebugRecorder

  • public class DebugRecorder
extends java.lang.Object
    This class is used to record debugging information that can be accessed during run-time through a client. The debugging information is in the form of a vector of strings. Each debugging vector is stored in a table under a key that is supplied by the user.

    The SOCRobotBrain and related classes use 2 recorders to capture info about its current building plan. When the bot begins planning a new piece, it swaps which of its recorders are active/previous.

    • Method Detail

      • turnOn

        public void turnOn()
        Turn the recorder on. This is an overall switch. To start recording information on a specific item or topic, must then call startRecording(Object).
        See Also:
        turnOff()

      • turnOff

        public void turnOff()
        Turn the overall recorder off. Also clears the item/topic previously set with startRecording(Object).
        See Also:
        turnOn()

      • isOn

        public boolean isOn()
        Returns:
        true if the recorder is on

      • startRecording

        public void startRecording(java.lang.Object key)
        Start recording the current plan information. Must call turnOn() first.
        Parameters:
        key - the item or topic key to use to index this recording
        See Also:
        stopRecording(), suspend()

      • stopRecording

        public void stopRecording()

        See Also:

        s - the string to add
